passage_text: Best Answer: There are a lot of fillers, but I rather have my story following the manga with the fillers than getting ruined by a randomly made ending of rage. Which will make many people rage. 131-135, Post-Alabasta Arc.

Rating Newest Oldest. Best Answer: There are a lot of fillers, but I rather have my story following the manga with the fillers than getting ruined by a randomly made ending of rage. Which will make many people rage. 131-135, Post-Alabasta Arc. Ocean's Dream Arc 220-224.

up vote 3 down vote favorite. I want to watch One Piece, but the anime has a lot of filler content not in the manga. I'd rather not watch the filler content and only watch the episodes which are directly related to the plot.

Luffy has eaten a devil fruit which gives him special abilities. Luffy can stretch every part of his body like rubber. In One Piece, Luffy gathers an awesome crew and travels the seas in search for gold and adventure. One Piece has a great story and does not have a lot of filler episodes.

One piece filler episodes are generally good. I once thought the G-8 filler arc was canon because it blended in with the main story so well. One of the reasons the filler episodes of one piece are generally good is because the producers first ask the mangaka(Eiichiro Oda) for permission.
